cards.detail: {{#patient}}You recently had high blood pressure readings (>= 140 mmHg systolic and/or >= mmHg 90 diastolic) which suggest you have hypertension, but there is no diagnosis in your chart. You may want to discuss your blood pressure with your care team.{{/patient}}{{#careTeam}}Patient had multiple blood pressure readings of SBP > 140mm Hg and/or DBP > 90. This suggests the patient may have Stage 2 Hypertension, but no diagnosis was found.{{/careTeam}}|[ { "id": "contact-suggestion", "label": "Contact care team", "type": "suggestion-link", "actions": [{"label":"Contact your care team about a high blood pressure diagnosis", "url":"/contact?token=possible-htn-stage2"}] } ]|at-most-one|[{"label":"AHA: Understanding High Blood Pressure Readings", "url":"https://www.heart.org/en/health-topics/high-blood-pressure/understanding-blood-pressure-readings"}]
